snippet: The 1836 “Victory or Death” letter from the doomed fortress has been exhibited outside Austin just three times between 1936 and 2006.
abstract: Plan to display the 1836 'Victory or Death' letter at the Alamo in San Antonio, Tex, is in peril as the board of the Texas State Library and Archives Commission cites security concerns; letter has been exhibited outside Austin just three times between 1936 and 2006.
lead_paragraph: The 1836 “Victory or Death” letter from the doomed fortress has been exhibited outside Austin just three times between 1936 and 2006.

headline.seo: Modern Alamo Battle Over Display of ‘Victory or Death’ Letter
headline.main: Modern Alamo Battle Over Plan to Display Letter
headline.print_headline: Modern Alamo Battle Over Plan to Display Letter
